title: Ask A Farmer | Ep. 2 | Peach Farmer

tasks.task: Answering questions about peach production in Arkansas
subtasks: Discussing reasons for fewer peach orchards in Arkansas today
Estimating the lifespan of a peach tree in commercial production
Describing the annual calendar of peach orchard management activities
Explaining the role of peach fuzz and the difference between free stone and cling peaches
Addressing whether peaches can be grown from pits
Discussing animal damage to peach orchards, particularly from deer and squirrels
Providing advice on managing insects on peach fruit
Addressing the etymology of the phrase "feeling peachy"

tasks.task: Responding to questions about peach production in Arkansas
subtasks: Discussing labor challenges in the orchard (mental and physical aspects of managing labor)
Describing the pruning process (physical activity of cutting branches)
Thinning peaches (physical manual removal of excess fruit)
Harvesting peaches (physical activity of picking fruit, climbing ladders, moving baskets)
Mowing around trees (physical work with a mower)
Applying pesticides or fungicides (physical application, handling tools)
Maintaining deer fences (physical construction and maintenance)
Dealing with animal damage (physical, could include traps or scaring techniques)
Planning for next season's crop (includes pruning and potentially grafting, physically preparing trees)
